thread.title: Planet Holidays expands in a 'timeless classic'
thread.title_full: Planet Holidays expands in a 'timeless classic'

title: Planet Holidays expands in a 'timeless classic'
text:
Planet Holidays expands in a 'timeless classic' 24 July 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
Planet Holidays is backing Greece as a tourist destination with the introduction of eight additional islands for next year’s programme. 
Managing director Mathilde Robert said the additional islands, including Ithaca, Milos and Naxos, now brings the total on offer to 20 for the 2016 edition. 
Elsewhere, additional properties have been added on the operator’s most popular islands including Crete, Corfu, Rhodes, Kos and Mykonos. 
Robert said the operator was also hoping to give the destination further exposure by moving it to the front of the brochure. 
She added: “With the financial turmoil of the past years, there is much in the media that may influence travellers from booking their next holiday to Greece. 
“However, while we watch the coverage at home, others are still enjoying this country and Greece’s appeal will continue as it has done for centuries. We are determined to support this nation.” 
Prices lead in at £749 for one week’s B&B accommodation in Ithaca, departing in June.
